definition: (onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
(onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
(onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
(onom.) rustling sound/sound of rain or of sth falling down/in disorder/completely smashed/badly battered/broken to pieces
variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]

sentences.english: I think my brother has finally kicked the gambling habit.
sentences.chinese: 我想我哥哥算是絕對改掉牌賭的惡習啦。

sentences.english: Today play bullfight lose 1500 dollars depressing dead.
sentences.chinese: 今天打鬥牛輸啦1500塊錢鬱悶死了。

sentences.english: A gaggle of schoolgirls followed the tennis star to his car.
sentences.chinese: 一羣嘰哩呱啦的女學生跟著網球明星到他的車子。

sentences.english: That was so cool! Hey, Dad, did you see that?
sentences.chinese: 哇，好好玩啦嘿，爸爸看到沒有？

sentences.english: The doctors tell me that's what has knocked my digestion out being so infernally jealous of her.
sentences.chinese: 醫生們說我消化不良就是因爲我對她嫉妒得太厲害啦。

sentences.english: All you have to do is get an A on the next test, and then you can pass Math!
sentences.chinese: 你只要在下一次考試拿A就行啦，你的數學就能過了。

sentences.english: Most colleges do not pay energy to promote cheerleading publicly.
sentences.chinese: 大多數高校甚至沒有對啦啦操做任何宣傳。

sentences.english: Most colleges do not pay energy to promote cheerleading publicly.
sentences.chinese: 大多數高校甚至沒有對啦啦操做任何宣傳。

sentences.english: Confucius' thought and theory of later generations produced profound influence.
sentences.chinese: 孔子地思惟及學說對後世發生啦極端深遠地影響。

sentences.english: Sure, we can go boating there and eat at the farm house.
sentences.chinese: 當然有啦，我們可以划船，還可以喫到農家菜啊。

sentences.english: You got it all upside down, " shouted Matt at Thorne."
sentences.chinese: “你完全搞顛倒啦，”麥特向桑恩嚷起來。

sentences.english: " Big cocks and old hens walked over to spend, "touch Where's the matter?
sentences.chinese: 大公雞和老花母雞走過去，“碰哪兒啦？

sentences.english: I had no idea in what terms one shouted at koalas, but I did my best.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道別人用什麼字眼來叫，不過，我盡力而爲啦。

sentences.english: So, what I said is swamped.
sentences.chinese: 就是說，我說的話全白說啦。

sentences.english: 'Nowhere Man' came, words and music, the whole damn thing.
sentences.chinese: 方外之人來啦，歌詞和音樂，所有他媽的一切。

definition: (final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(particle) marker of surprise, sudden realization, reminder
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
(Internet slang for 然而[ran2 er2]) however
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
